skill.name: design-to-code
skill.description: Pixel-perfect Figma to React conversion using coderio. Generates production-ready code (TypeScript, Vite, TailwindCSS V4) with high visual fidelity. Features robust error handling, checkpoint recovery, and streamlined execution via helper script.
skill.summary: Pixel-perfect Figma to React conversion using coderio. Generates production-ready code (TypeScript, ...
skill.author: MigoXLab

security_audit.summary: All 121 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate Figma-to-React conversion tool that uses network (Figma API), filesystem (read/write project files), and external commands (Node.js scripts) as expected for its purpose. No credential exfiltration, no malicious code, no prompt injection attempts detected.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm
high_findings.description: Static scanner detected 'weak crypto' patterns in LICENSE.txt and code. These are false positives - pattern matches on license text words like 'sha' and 'hash', and code comments. No actual cryptographic operations in the skill.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Reviewed actual code - no cryptographic operations. Pattern matching on license text and variable names.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Windows SAM Database Access
high_findings.description: Static scanner detected 'SAM database' patterns. These are false positives - pattern matches on 'SYSTEM' in 'INITIAL_AGENT_SYSTEM_PROMPT' variable name.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Line 10 is an import statement, line 104 is console.log of a prompt variable. No Windows system files accessed.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Certificate/Key Files Access
high_findings.description: Static scanner detected 'certificate/key' patterns. This is a false positive - pattern match on component 'groups' variable which groups UI components, not certificates.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Variable 'groups' stores component groups for Figma UI elements, not certificate files.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Ruby/Shell Backtick Execution
high_findings.description: Static scanner detected backtick usage as shell execution. These are false positives - backticks in SKILL.md are markdown code block delimiters, and in coderio-skill.mjs are string template literals for prompt generation.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks used for markdown code blocks and JavaScript template strings, not shell command execution.

high_findings.title: False Positive: System Reconnaissance
high_findings.description: Static scanner detected reconnaissance patterns. These are false positives - pattern matches on license text words.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Pattern matching on generic words in documentation, no actual reconnaissance code.

content.user_title: Convert Figma Designs to React Code
content.value_statement: Transform Figma designs into production-ready React TypeScript components with pixel-perfect accuracy. This skill automates the design-to-code workflow using AI to generate clean, structured code.
actual_capabilities: Fetch designs from Figma API using user-provided token and URL
Generate component structure and hierarchy from Figma frames
Extract props and state data from Figma component instances
Produce production-ready React TypeScript code with TailwindCSS V4
Manage asset downloads and file organization for generated code
limitations: Requires valid Figma API token and file access permissions
User must manually attach Figma thumbnail for AI visual reference
Does not support complex interactive behaviors or animations
Component generation requires sequential execution of phases

use_cases.title: Frontend Developer Workflow
use_cases.description: Quickly convert Figma mockups into working React components for prototyping or production use.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers who receive design files from designers

use_cases.title: Rapid Prototyping
use_cases.description: Generate boilerplate React code from design files to accelerate MVP development.
use_cases.target_user: Startup developers and product teams building MVPs

use_cases.title: Design System Implementation
use_cases.description: Extract individual components from Figma design systems into reusable React code.
use_cases.target_user: Design system engineers maintaining component libraries

prompt_templates.title: Simple Figma Fetch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the design-to-code skill to fetch my Figma design. The Figma file URL is [FIGMA_URL] and my access token is [TOKEN].
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner - Fetch a Figma design for conversion

prompt_templates.title: Component Structure Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the structure-prompt command, then analyze the attached thumbnail.png to generate the component structure JSON. Save the result to scripts/structure-output.json.
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate - Generate component hierarchy from design

prompt_templates.title: Props Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Run list-components to see available components. Then for each component, run props-prompt [COMPONENT_NAME], analyze the thumbnail, and save the props to scripts/[COMPONENT_NAME]-props.json.
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate - Extract data props from Figma components

prompt_templates.title: Full Design to Code Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the full design-to-code pipeline: 1) fetch-figma with my token, 2) generate structure and process, 3) extract props for all components, 4) generate code for each task using code-prompt and save-code.

output_examples.output: Figma data processed. Thumbnail saved to process/thumbnail.png
Generates detailed prompt for AI to analyze thumbnail and produce component hierarchy JSON

output_examples.input: AI analyzes thumbnail.png and generates component structure
output_examples.output: JSON structure with frames, groups, and component hierarchy ready for props extraction

best_practices: Always attach the Figma thumbnail.png when requesting AI to analyze or generate code
Execute phases in sequential order: Setup â†’ Protocol â†’ Code
Verify checkpoint files exist (processed.json, protocol.json) before proceeding to next phase
anti_patterns: Skipping the thumbnail attachment during AI analysis steps
Running code generation before props extraction is complete
Using invalid or expired Figma API tokens

faq.question: What do I need to use this skill?
faq.answer: You need a Figma account, a Figma Personal Access Token, and Node.js 18+ installed. The skill uses coderio npm package for Figma operations.

faq.question: How does the Figma token work?
faq.answer: The token is provided by you when running fetch-figma. It is used only to access the specific Figma file you specify. No token is stored by the skill.

faq.question: Can I convert any Figma design?
faq.answer: Most static Figma designs convert well. Complex interactive components, animations, and nested prototypes may require manual adjustments after conversion.

faq.question: What code does this generate?
faq.answer: The skill generates React TypeScript components using Vite project structure and TailwindCSS V4 for styling.

faq.question: Why do I need to attach the thumbnail?
faq.answer: The AI uses the visual thumbnail to understand spacing, layout nuances, and text content that may not be fully captured in the raw Figma JSON data.

faq.question: What happens if a step fails?
faq.answer: The skill provides error messages indicating what went wrong. Common issues include: invalid tokens, missing thumbnail, empty AI responses, or running steps out of order.
